Phoenix and Magma Heart in Kawrea
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Errantry: Kawrea: Phoenix and Magma Heart in Kawrea
By locke on Friday, May 19, 2000 - 07:23 am:

The Kawrea Errantry is the only one where I'm told there's a chance of getting any techs (without the 'but it may be hard right now' statement). But every time I go, I get no new tech. Instead, I wind up facing either Magma Heart or Blue Phoenix. I can't find any mention of this in the archives, though I think there may once have been. Can anybody tell me if I have to beat one of those 2 before getting a tech, or is it the key to getting some special item? Or is it just a bad run of randoms I'm getting?
Thanks!

By Kurasu Soratobu on Friday, May 19, 2000 - 10:54 am:

I've had the same trouble, actually. I mean, not being able to get a tech, no matter what I do. And no, beating either of those two won't help at all, I'm sorry to say.

Unless you're only taking advantage of the cheap errantries, I suggest saving, then spending a week and trying again next week. It's the only way I was able to get one to 'roll' better on the random chart for me. Also, is it possible that it's a good tech and you have an evil monster, or vice versa? Or is it a 'breed' tech? I've had a time or two that even when it said there was a tech for me, I couldn't learn it no matter what, and decided it must be one of those two.

So, the partial answer to your question is 'no'. Beating either of those two won't get you the tech (although it really feels good, if you can manage to do it!). As for the other half.... your guess is as good as mine, unfortunately.

By locke on Friday, May 19, 2000 - 04:01 pm:

Thanks, Kurasu! I hadn't thought about the good/bad issue. That sounds like a reasonable assumption.

By locke on Friday, May 19, 2000 - 08:23 pm:

Here's an update - I went back after a couple of months, and it let me have Mocchi Beam. So now I don't know why it didn't work at first, but your other advice (to try later) did the trick! Thanks!
